tumor_size_max_dimension_evidence: Greatest dimension of tumor is stated as 5.0 em (equivalent to 5.0 cm) in the pathology report.
pT_evidence: The tumor size of 5.0 cm falls within the T2a category according to AJCC 7th edition criteria.
pN_evidence: No tumor seen in all lymph nodes examined, indicating no regional lymph node metastasis (N0).
tumor_stage_evidence: Based on pT2a and pN0, the tumor stage is estimated as Stage IB according to AJCC7 criteria.
histologic_diagnosis_evidence: The report describes the tumor as poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma.
comment: The pathology report details a right upper lobe lobectomy for a lung mass, revealing a poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma measuring 5.0 cm in greatest dimension. Surgical margins and examined lymph nodes are free of tumor. The high-grade nature of the tumor is noted with rare mucin-positive cells, supporting an adenocarcinoma diagnosis.
